article_title: The Equity Project Charter School Gets a Big Backer
article_text:
To be clear, Leo Hindery Jr. doesn’t see charter schools as a cure-all for the country’s education system.

But even though he has his heart set on a much broader education-system overhaul, he said, sometimes the work of a single charter school and its students can make “your head snap back.” That happened for him with the Equity Project Charter School, known as TEP.

Mr. Hindery, the 67-year-old managing partner of New...

twitter.description: Leo Hindery Jr., managing partner of private-equity firm InterMedia Partners, is putting his money and his influence behind an effort to build a new school for the Equity Project Charter School in Manhattan.
twitter.creator: @MelanieGWest

image.alt: The Equity Project Charter School in Manhattan gets a big backer
